title: Regen vs maximum hp and mp
body:
When picking masteries, runes and items, which is preferred? The only time it's really clear is when the champion is Soraka taking health regen, Vladimir taking HP, Ryze taking MP and Veigar taking mana regen. 

Which is better against harass?
Which is better if you rarely take damage?
Which is better if you're in X lane or jungle?
Etc

replies.body: your better off taking spell vamp as vlad just saying

Im sorry, but no you dont.  ap/mr/armour page for vlad  for maxx sustain, then build according to lane match up.
as vlad you want to have the ap for damage and survivability in his case, but you also want the hp for passive and armour/mr for mid/late game team fights.

Scaling HP and AP beats armour and MR, not only is HP harder to get rid of in mid lane than MR (rush scorc treads, goodbye runes.), but you get AP on top of it, and armour is easy to get or replace,

And Vlad's passive makes it 100x better

The purpose of runes isn't usually to get the most value out of them lategame. Runes like flat armour/MR/HP will make a HUGE difference in the early game against competent opponents and can be the difference between living and dying or getting zoned off cs. The marginal benifit you get from scaling runes isn't worth it if you're losing gold because you died/missed out on a kill/ had to play safer than you otherwise would have had to.

Scaling runes are usually only useful if you wouldn't get much benefit from flats in the early game (e.g scaling AP/MR/CDR blues vs AD lanes or in the jungle)

In season 5 you gain better stats in level 6 with scaling runes. It's not hard to get to level 6 in mid because you're laning someone without an ult. it'd still be very early in game and I'd probably be level 6 in the first eight minutes of the match

Scaling AP beats flat MR regardless and scaling HP still matters mid game while defense stats easily get removed with penetration

Level 1-6 is a very important time in the game and even a small advantage here can snowball into a much bigger one later on. I think you undervalue how much impact the early game can have on the rest of the game

But level 6 can be achieved in less than 8 minutes in mid, usually the only way to get first blood so early is:

a) you play a champ that specifically can kill without an ult (Usually not Xerath, Lux or Malzahar, but probably TF, Morganna or LeBlanc)

b) have a very early gank

c) have a bad gank from the enemy's still underlevelled jungler.

Runes very rarely change this. I don't know about when other people play mid, but I get to lvl 6 so early by getting the farm I need instead of wasting time trying to kill with less than four abilities that I'd gladly take scaling runes, and only bother to use flat runes with stats I need right at the start (MR against LeBlanc, Akali or Fizz, who all can get first blood very very easily, but not against poke or harass champions), or if I'm in a duo lane.

If I was support or ADC I'd definitely take flats, mid and top are definitely better with scaling but top can do with flats if they need it truly, and jungle depends on the type (gank vs control vs farm jungler).
